TopicTitle: N-3 launch vehicle: What could have been an effective light carrier rocket?

Articles.Content:
When Korolev was designing the N-1 it was said that he designed it to be a "universal rocket" (non dedicated, "add more boosters", exp angara) a trend that was becoming popular in the 60's USSR due to the thought of it being cheaper. So n-1 was designed so all of the 3 main stages would be their "own" LV.

The third stage with the mini 4th stage would be the N-3 rocket capable of 2.5 tonnes to leo.

2nd, 3rd and 4th stage would be the N-2 capable of 25 tonnes to leo.

And the complete N-1 with 95 tonnes to leo.

However I want to focus on the small N-3, I personally believe this could have been a very good LV. It would have stood at 25 meters (not counting fairings) with 5 engines in total (1s:4, 2s:1) I believe it could have been very cheap, there are also lots of 2.5- payloads these days. Also who knows, maybe n-2 could have outdone the proton.

What do you think?
